'''Tolkien 'Signature' Paperback Series''' unofficially refers to a series of new editions (or reprints) of some core Tolkien-books published by [[HarperCollins]], it started in [[2022]] and is ongoing as of [[2025]]. This new format is a trade paperback with a uniform dimension and matching cover designs, which features an elegant mono-colored background with [[J.R.R. Tolkien]]'s signature on the top, in the center is a pattern or artwork relevant to the book's content. The series started in [[2022]] with ''[[The Hobbit]]'' and the 3-volume ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]'', then in [[2023]] extending to ''[[The Silmarillion]]'', ''[[Unfinished Tales]]'', 12 volumes of ''[[The History of Middle-earth]]'' plus the ''[[The History of Middle-earth Index|Index]]'', and also the three "Great Tales". In [[2024]] shorter works ''[[Tales from the Perilous Realm]]'', ''[[The Adventures of Tom Bombadil]]'', and ''[[Farmer Giles of Ham]]'' were released in this format, and from [[2025]] it also includes ''[[Roverandom]]'', ''[[Smith of Wootton Major]]'', and ''[[Tree and Leaf]]''. Also released in 2025 are ''[[The Road to Middle-earth]]'', ''[[Tolkien On Fairy-stories]]'', ''[[The Nature of Middle-earth]]'', and then ''[[Sir Gawain and the Green Knight, Pearl, and Sir Orfeo|Sir Gawain and the Green Knight]]'', ''[[The Legend of Sigurd and Gudrún]]'', ''[[The Story of Kullervo]]'', ''[[A Secret Vice: Tolkien on Invented Languages|A Secret Vice]]'', and then ''[[Finn and Hengest: The Fragment and the Episode|Finn and Hengest]]'', ''[[The Monsters and the Critics, and Other Essays|The Monsters and the Critics]]''. ==Gallery== File:The Hobbit 2024.jpeg|[[The Hobbit]] File:The Lord of the Rings 2023-v1.jpeg|[[The Fellowship of the Ring]] File:The Lord of the Rings 2023-v2.jpeg|[[The Two Towers]] File:The Lord of the Rings 2023-v3.jpeg|[[The Return of the King]] File:The Lord of the Rings OV 2022-pb-2.jpg|[[The Lord of the Rings]]
